clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the prevention of angina pectoris due to coronary artery disease

contraindications.disease: Symptoms of overdose include reduced cardiac output and hypotension
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Isosorbide Dinitrate is a moderate to long acting oral organic nitrate used for the relief and prophylactic management of angina pectoris It relaxes the vascular smooth muscle and consequent dilatation of peripheral arteries and veins especially the latter Dilatation of the veins promotes peripheral pooling of blood and decreases venous return to the heart thereby reducing left ventricular end diastolic pressure and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure preload Arteriolar relaxation reduces systemic vascular resistance systolic arterial pressure and mean arterial pressure

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of orthostatic hypotension and syncope can be increased when Isosorbide dinitrate is combined with Duloxetine
The risk or severity of hypotension and orthostatic hypotension can be increased when Isosorbide dinitrate is combined with Levodopa
Isosorbide dinitrate may increase the hypotensive activities of Risperidone
The risk or severity of methemoglobinemia can be increased when Isosorbide dinitrate is combined with Prilocaine
Dapoxetine may increase the orthostatic hypotensive and hypotensive activities of Isosorbide dinitrate
Isosorbide dinitrate may increase the hypotensive activities of Riociguat
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Isosorbide dinitrate is combined with Rosiglitazone
Aripiprazole may increase the hypotensive activities of Isosorbide dinitrate
